content.webTitle: TV tonight: foul-mouthed Alma's dark, dry and addictive journey

fields.headline: TV tonight: foul-mouthed Alma's dark, dry and addictive journey
fields.bodyText: Alma’s Not Normal 10pm, BBC Two Aspiring actor and foul-mouthed Boltonian Alma Nuthall (Sophie Willan) is trying to get her life back on track following a breakup with her childhood sweetheart and a long streak of unemployment. First, though, she has to deal with her vodka-drinking gran Joan and her sectioned mum, who is also battling a heroin addiction. Dark, dry and addictive, Willan’s writing and portrayal make this a touching series on mental health and difficult female relationships, with plenty of laughs thrown in for good measure. Ammar Kalia Your Home Made Perfect 8pm, BBC Two Angela Scanlon presents a new series of this visually striking home improvement show. Using virtual reality simulations, home owners can experience potential renovations before they waste their time and money on them. But will that loft conversion or garden revamp live up to their expectations? Phil Harrison The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer 8pm, Channel 4 The final of this charitable take on Bake Off sees Kelly Brook, Rob Rinder, Carol Vorderman and Mo Gilligan go head to head in the tent. They are set three fiendish challenges to close off the series: a sandwich biscuit, a sweet bread bake, and a guilty pleasure cake showstopper. AK The Art Mysteries With Waldemar Januszczak 8.30pm, BBC Four Januszczak turns his art detective’s gaze on to Paul Cézanne’s Card Players in the final part of this art history series. What on the surface seems a simple composition soon reveals the artist’s fascination with patron saints and the developing Catholicism of his old age. AK Return to Belsen 9pm, ITV Jonathan Dimbleby retraces the steps of his father Richard, whose broadcast from the newly liberated Belsen concentration camp remains one of the most stunning pieces of reportage on the Holocaust. Seventy-five years on, Dimbleby Jr visits the site and hears the precious testimony of the few surviving witnesses. Jack Seale A Country Life for Half the Price With Kate Humble 9pm, Channel 5 Kate Humble follows the Cook family who, desperate to escape the suburban rat race, want to move to Shetland and start again, debt free. As mum Gen says: “I’m hoping that in a few years’ time we’ll look back and say: ‘We did it, we went on an adventure.’” Will they succeed? Ali Catterall Film choice The Adventures of Tintin, 6.50pm, Film4 Hergé’s adventures of Belgium’s most famous cartoon cub reporter come to near-life, in slightly weird motion-capture animation. Tintin (Jamie Bell), Captain Haddock (Andy Serkis) and Snowy are vying with Daniel Craig’s evil Sakharine in the hunt for ancient treasure manuscripts, rushing through typical Steven Spielberg scrapes from stormy seas to the Sahara desert: a really ripping yarn. Paul Howlett
